name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
steps: Boil 4 cups of water in a pot. Add salt.
Cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, thinly slice garlic.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-low heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook until garlic is fragrant and lightly golden, about 2-3 minutes. Do not burn the garlic.
Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water.
Add cooked spaghetti to the skillet with garlic and oil. Toss to combine.
Add reserved pasta water, a little at a time, until a light sauce forms and coats the pasta.
Stir in fresh parsley, salt, and black pepper. Serve immediately.

name: Pancakes
steps: In a large bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg. Stir in the milk and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Do not overmix; a few lumps are okay.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake.
Cook for 2 to 3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve hot with your favorite toppings.
